paragraphs.content: Data Scientist in training with 5+ years of experience as a Front-End Developer for SCADA systems. Skilled in Python, SQL, JS, and CSS, with academic grounding in machine learning, time series, and open data. Currently completing a master’s in Data Science and pursuing industry-recognized certificates in AI, Cloud Computing, and BI.

dd.content: EU/EEA citizen (Spain); eligible to work across the EU/EEA. Switzerland: up to 90 working days per calendar year with prior online notification.

paragraphs.content: Developing an MLOps infrastructure on Linux with TLS, Python, and C++98 for distributed Machine Learning and Deep Learning systems.
Currently working on thread management and bottleneck removal to reduce k-NN latency from 500–700 ms to 150–200 ms in a 5 FPS video pipeline.
Supporting the Lead Data Scientist on ELT processes and model training.
Delivered a custom JS/CSS charting tool as initial assignment, still operative after 5 years in a SCADA dashboard spanning 12+ production views.
Designed SCADA HMI components for 5+ industrial domains by reverse-engineering legacy Java/GWT code and over 100,000 undocumented XLS rows.
Built state-aware interactive elements using SVG, PNG, and CSS, improving system clarity and usability.
Ran diagnostics from backend logs to identify behavioral anomalies and support system maintenance.

sections.title: 2024/25 Best Academic Records Award – M.Sc. in Data Science
sections.organisationAnchorText: Link to UPM – School of Computer Science

paragraphs.content: From the award announcement:
“Aimed at students (up to a maximum of 4) who started the Master’s in Data Science in September 2024. The awards are funded by Universidad Politécnica de Madrid (Ayudas a Máster oficiales).

The award (450 Euros) requires the student to be a new full-time student in the MSc in Data Science of any nationality and to have passed the enrolled mandatory subjects and obtained the highest grades (average of the 10 subjects).”

sections.title: 2018/19 Best B.Sc. Thesis in Telematics Engineering
sections.organisationAnchorText: Link to UPCT – School of Telecommunications

paragraphs.content: My undergraduate thesis was selected by the ETSIT college at Universidad Politécnica de Cartagena (UPCT) as the best final project of the 2018/19 academic year in Telematics Engineering. It was then submitted on behalf of the university to the national competition “Premios COITT Futuro de las Telecomunicaciones,” which recognizes the best B.Sc. theses in Telecommunications across Spain.
